class_notes:
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Tradition-Judaism, Region. 
This course will explore the history and experiences of Jews in Georgia from the colonial period through the present. We will investigate the social, political, economic, religious, and cultural development of Jews and Jewish communities in Georgia, and the southern United States more broadly. As we move forward, we will keep an eye on the interactions between Jews and their neighbors, particularly with respect to racial, religious, and gendered difference.


(Same as REL 370 2)
course_description: This course will focus on particular aspects of or themes in Judaism or Jewish culture and how it is practiced. Topics will vary.
